intro: [WRONG START] Embilia legnophylla, commonly known as the red-rooted embelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and glossy, dark green leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. The plant has a distinctive red root system, which is a key feature in its common name.
